business.headline: BSE shares down 65% today, but has multibagger stock really crashed?The apparent crash was just a technical adjustment following the company's 2:1 bonus issue, which turned the stock ex-bonus today. Some trading platforms may not have accounted for this corporate action in their price charts, leading to misleading visuals of a steep 65% drop. In reality, the share price simply adjusted to reflect the bonus allotment.

Sensex jumps 600 points after flat start: Why stock market is rising todayMarket watchers suggest the current bounce is likely driven by a 'buy-on-dips' strategy that many investors have adopted amid recent volatility. Despite concerns about the global macro environment, the strength in domestic fundamentals seems to be offering support.

Honasa shares rise 13% despite decline in Q4 net profitThe company's revenue from operations went up by 13% year-on-year (YoY), reaching Rs 534 crore in Q4FY25. However, despite the rise in revenue, Honasa's consolidated net profit fell by 18% YoY.
Sensex, Nifty move up in early session despite concerns over FII flowsThe S&P BSE Sensex went up by 289.27 points to 81,241.26, while the NSE Nifty50 added 119.15 points to 24,728.85 as of 9:29 am.

Borana Weaves IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusBorana Weaves IPO opened for subscription on May 20 and closed on May 22. The IPO saw strong demand from all investor groups. It was subscribed 147.85 times in total.

GST rates may change soon as fresh revamp talks begin: ReportGST, which was launched in July 2017, brought together many indirect taxes into one system and created a single national market. The latest round of talks follows the government's introduction of a bill in February this year to simplify income tax laws.

Sensex, Nifty opening: Stock market likely to open higher today. Here's whyStock market opening: The Nifty50 index may open slightly above its previous close. Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,692.5 at 7:59 am, showing a possible rise from Thursday's close of 24,609.7.

Stocks to watch on May 23: ITC, Ola, Honasa, Sun Pharma, JSW SteelA number of companies will release their January-March quarter results today. These include JSW Steel, Ashok Leyland, Glenmark Pharmaceuticals, Afcons Infrastructure, etc.

Sensex closes 645 points lower, Nifty below 24,700; IndusInd Bank gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 644.64 points to end at 80,951.99, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 203.75 points to close at 24,609.70.

Borana Weaves IPO booked over 100 times: Check latest subscription, GMPAllotment for the Borana Weaves IPO is expected to be finalised on Friday, May 23, 2025. The company is likely to list its shares on the stock exchanges on Tuesday, May 27, 2025.
Reliance to start solar module factory this year: ReportThis year, Reliance Industries will launch its solar module factory, aiming to meet India's clean energy goals by producing 20 GW annually.

World's happiest and unhappiest careers revealed. Is your job among them?Researchers at the University of Tartu in Estonia looked at 263 different jobs and asked over 59,000 people about their work and life satisfaction. They also used health data from the Estonian Biobank to get a better picture of what really makes people happy in their jobs.

entertainment.headline: Urvashi Rautela goes bold in gold at Cannes. Don't miss the bikini clutchActor Urvashi Rautela grabbed attention at Cannes in a gold outfit. However, it was the bikini-shaped clutch that truly stole the spotlight, sparking conversations across social media for its bold and quirky design.

Ace review: Vijay Sethupathi's charm elevates convenient storytellingReleased-Fri May 23, 2025Ace movie review: Director Arumugakumar's 'Ace', starring Vijay Sethupathi, Rukmini Vasanth and BS Avinash, is a heist drama that relies heavily on one character. The film's convenient writing is its biggest letdown.

KSHMR 'not into K-pop' despite his samples being used by idolsKSHMR has become an unexpected yet significant contributor to the K-pop music scene through his sound samples. He revealed that he is not a K-pop fan personally and shared why his samples might have been a hit in the industry.

Aishwarya Rai casts magic in black at Cannes, twins with daughter Aaradhya. WatchAishwarya Rai Bachchan impressed fans with her striking look on Day 2 of the Cannes Film Festival. The actor stole the spotlight in a black Gaurav Gupta creation.

2025 American Music Awards: Jennifer Lopez to host, Janet Jackson to receive icon awardThe 2025 AMAs will air live from Las Vegas on May 26, featuring performances by Jennifer Lopez, Janet Jackson, and more. Kendrick Lamar leads nominations. Tributes to US veterans included.

Scarlett Johansson shines at Cannes with grief-themed film 'Eleanor the Great'Scarlett Johansson made her directorial debut at Cannes with Eleanor the Great, a touching film on grief and identity, starring June Squibb, earning acclaim and a standing ovation at the premiere.

Kid Cudi testifies Diddy broke into his home, car set on fire weeks laterKid Cudi testified that Sean "Diddy" Combs broke into his home after learning of his relationship with Cassie. Weeks later, Cudi's car was set on fire with a Molotov cocktail inside.

K-Pop stars turn Demon slayers in Netflix's new animated filmNetflix's KPop Demon Hunters anime follows three K-pop idols who secretly battle demons. With music, magic, and mystery, the film releases globally on June 20, promising action-packed supernatural fun.

Kamal Haasan on dealing with release day pressure: With age, we learn to take blameActor Kamal Haasan, during the promotions of his upcoming film Thug Life, reflected on handling release-day pressure and the importance of staying humble and grounded.

Rajkummar Rao joins filmmaker Soojit Sircar in a two-hero comedy film: ReportRajkummar Rao has reportedly teamed up with director Shoojit Sircar for an upcoming two-hero satirical comedy. Filming is set to begin in late 2025, with the search for the second lead currently underway.

Prateik Smita Patil on dropping his surname: I didn't want to belong to themActor Prateik Smita Patil recently opened up about the custody battle between his late mother's family and father Raj Babbar. He also reflected on how he initially felt bitter about his parents.

Jewellery brand ropes in Shah Rukh Khan to target Gen Z, millennialsActor Shah Rukh Khan has been roped in by lifestyle jewellery brand Candere as its ambassador. Shah Rukh expressed his admiration for jewellery as symbolic of love, memories and identity.

Kajol seeks blessings at Kolkata's Dakshineswar Kali temple ahead of her film MaaAfter seeking blessings at the Dakshineswar Kali Temple in Kolkata, Kajol called her role in 'Maa' her strongest ever. Directed by Vishal Furia, the film will follow her powerful journey as a mother fiercely protecting her daughter.

Exclusive: Music artist KSHMR explains how he makes money from royalty-free musicAmerican musician KSHMR explains how he earns from royalty-free music samples used globally, including by popular K-pop groups. He also shared how he incorporates his Indian roots into his music.

Sunny Deol to make his OTT debut with director Sidharth P Malhotra: ReportSunny Deol is set to make his Netflix debut with an action thriller directed by Siddharth P Malhotra, adapted from the 2007 film 'Death Sentence'. The project, written by Suparn Verma, begins filming in July 2025 and marks a major addition to Deol's packed slate of upcoming releases.

Silambarasan on playing a feminine role in STR 50: Took notes from Kamal HaasanActor Silambarasan confirms playing a character with feminine traits in his upcoming film, STR 50. He revealed that he discussed the role with Kamal Haasan to understand the nuances better.

Suniel Shetty reacts to backlash over normal delivery remark: Comment was twistedSuniel Shetty addressed backlash over his comments on daughter Athiya's natural delivery, clarifying his remarks were taken out of context. He issued a sincere apology to women, emphasising respect for all birthing choices.

Pankaj Tripathi debunks rumours of replacing Paresh Rawal in Hera Pheri 3Actor Pankaj Tripathi recently reacted to the ongoing fans' appeal about replacing Paresh Rawal in 'Hera Pheri 3.' The actor reasoned why he was not the right choice to play Baburao Ganpatrao Apte.

Explained: Tamannaah's Mysore Sandal deal and non-Kannadiga ambassador backlashActor Tamannaah was signed on as the brand ambassador of Mysore Sandal Soap, which did not go down well with a section of people on the Internet. Many questioned the Karnataka government's decision to appoint a Bollywood actor for the brand over Kannada actors.

general news.headline: Harvard's Indian, foreign students can stay if they meet 6 conditions in 3 daysIn 72 hours, Harvard University has been asked by the Trump administration to comply with six strict conditions to enroll foreign students again.

If you block our water…: Pak Army official parrots Hafiz Saeed in threat to IndiaA Pakistani military spokesperson's threatening remarks towards India, echoing Lashkar-e-Taiba chief Hafiz Saeed's inflammatory language about water, highlighted the alarming overlap between the Pakistan Army's rhetoric and the country's terror networks.

Yunus threatens to resign, protests might rock Dhaka yet againMuhammad Yunus, the head of the interim government in Bangladesh, threatened to resign if all the parties didn't offer him their full support. This came a day after Army Chief General Waker-Uz-Zaman called for elections to be held by December and the BNP sought a road map for polls. Yunus' resignation buzz is being seen as a ploy to launch a fresh agitation in Dhaka.

Delhi University objects to Rahul Gandhi's 'unannounced' campus visitDelhi University, objecting to Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's unannounced visit to the campus, said that it would take strict actions.
Birth of social media jihadists, death of Article 370In part 7 of our series on the history of terrorism in Kashmir, we revisit the evolution of jihad on social media, and the end of Article-370.

Microsoft replaces engineers with AI systems they helped build: ReportMicrosoft's recent layoffs have hit software engineers the hardest — just as the company pushes aggressively into AI-driven coding.

Bangladesh cancels Rs 180-crore defence contract with India amid diplomatic strainBangladesh has cancelled a Rs 180.25 crore defence contract with Kolkata-based company, likely in retaliation for India withdrawing transshipment facilities following diplomatic tensions.

Met all conditions: IMF justifies $1 billion bailout to debt-ridden PakistanThe IMF said Pakistan met all targets for its $1 billion loan, part of a $7 billion programme. "Funds go to central bank's reserves," clarified the IMF, adding that any policy deviation could impact future reviews.

The film's convenient writing is its biggest letdown.

My Name is Khan: Whither Justice in 'New' India?The recent arrest of Ali Khan Mahmudabad for an opinionated Facebook post reveals all that is horribly wrong with a political establishment that has pushed the Indian Muslim to the wall.

Imran Khan slams General Asim Munir, says Pakistan ruled by jungle lawFormer Pakistan PM Imran Khan slammed General Asim Munir's promotion to Field Marshal, calling Pakistan a "jungle law" regime, and condemned the government's suppression of justice and democracy.

Trump pauses Harvard University's ability to enroll international studentsThe Trump admin has revoked Harvard's certification to enrol international students, accusing it of promoting antisemitism and ties to China. Harvard called the move unlawful and vowed to keep supporting students from over 140 countries.

Israeli staffers' killing in Washington was planned, shooter said 'did it for Gaza': FBIAccording to an affidavit by the FBI, the Israeli Embassy staffers were murdered in cold blood, with the case described as calculated and well-planned. The authorities further said that Rodriguez carried a gun in his hand baggage as he was travelling to Washington from Chicago on Tuesday.

Pak rejected IndiGo pilot's request to use airspace to avoid turbulenceOn Wednesday, an IndiGo flight carrying 227 passengers from Delhi to Srinagar was caught in terrifying mid-air turbulence, sending those onboard into a panic and causing visible damage to the aircraft's nose.

Sensex jumps 600 points after flat start: Why stock market is rising todayMarket watchers suggest the current bounce is likely driven by a 'buy-on-dips' strategy that many investors have adopted amid recent volatility. Despite concerns about the global macro environment, the strength in domestic fundamentals seems to be offering support.

Pakistan's Arshad Nadeem responds to Neeraj Chopra's 'not close friends' commentPakistan's Arshad Nadeem was asked for his thoughts on Neeraj Chopra's recent comments about their camaraderie. The Olympic champion also reiterated that his ultimate goal is to breach the 100-metre mark in men's javelin.

Sanskrit shlok, Banarasi cape: Aishwarya Rai's Cannes outfit celebrates IndiaAishwarya Rai Bachchan made a strong fashion statement at Cannes 2025 as she walked the red carpet in a Gaurav Gupta creation - a black gown with a silver Banarasi brocade cape.

Mentally unstable uncle kills toddler, throws severed head into pond in Tamil NaduA 2.5-year-old girl was brutally killed by her mentally unstable uncle in Tamil Nadu's Ramanathapuram. He severed her head and threw it into a pond. Police recovered the body and arrested the uncle.

Operation Murshidabad Part 1: Anatomy of a riot and politics that let it burnIndia Today's post-riot investigation—now corroborated by the findings of a Calcutta High Court-appointed fact-finding committee—reveals a troubling ecosystem of silence and complicity. India Today TV spoke to minors involved in the arson, eyewitnesses, and senior investigating officers who were privy to the developments from day one.
Muslim family offers venue after rain disrupts Hindu wedding in PuneHeavy rain disrupted a Hindu wedding in Pune, prompting a nearby Muslim family to offer their reception hall for the ceremony.

Urvashi Rautela goes bold in gold at Cannes. Don't miss the bikini clutchActor Urvashi Rautela grabbed attention at Cannes in a gold outfit. However, it was the bikini-shaped clutch that truly stole the spotlight, sparking conversations across social media for its bold and quirky design.

Video of ex-US Senate staffer having sex in Capitol leaked, he says 'was bored'Aidan Maese-Czeropski, the former US Senate staffer who had sex in a Capitol hearing room, said that he "was bored" and has "no regrets" about the act.

Supreme Court halts IAF's release of officer involved in Op Sindoor from serviceDelivering the judgement, a bench of Justices Surya Kant and N Kotiswar Singh stayed Wing Commander Sucheta's release from the Air Force on being denied a Permanent Commission until further orders.

Exclusive: What UK court said on denying Nirav Modi bail for 10th timeA UK High Court recently rejected the bail plea of fugitive economic offender Nirav Modi for the tenth time. He is the prime accused in the Rs 13,000 crore Punjab National Bank (PNB) fraud case.

sports.headline: Not too concerned: RCB head coach on long 20-day break before SRH clashIPL 2025, RCB vs SRH: Royal Challengers Bengaluru haven't played any games in the last 20 days, but head coach Andy Flower said that it's not an area of concern for Rajat Patidar's men.

Two-tier Test cricket needed to give the format a narrative: VaughanFormer England captain Michael Vaughan has backed the introduction of a two-league Test cricket structure, arguing that the format needs narrative clarity and consistent top-tier competition to stay relevant in the modern era.

After a poor start, it was a mountain to climb for SRH: James FranklinIPL 2025, RCB vs SRH: In the pre-match press conference, bowling coach James Franklin said that it was always going to be a tough ask for the Sunrisers Hyderabad to make a comeback after a poor start to their campaign.

James Franklin upbeat for RCB clash: No lack of motivationIPL 2025, RCB vs SRH: Sunrisers Hyderabad bowling coach James Franklin said that there's no lack of motivation in the Orange Army camp despite their elimination from the tournament.

Novak Djokovic avenges Madrid defeat vs Arnaldi, storm into semisLast month, Djokovic lost to Matteo Arnaldi in the Italian Open, but the 24-time Grand Slam champion beat his Italian opponent in straight sets in the quarterfinal of the Geneva Open.

Strong Rishabh Pant has my respect: Justin LangerLucknow Super Giants head coach Justin Langer said that Rishabh Pant had his respect for the way that he carried himself around in a tough personal season. Pant's numbers have seen historic lows in his first outing with the team.

IPL playoffs race: RCB's top 2 hopes brighten after GT lose to LSGGujarat Titans' slip-up against LSG has blown the IPL top 2 race wide open. This has brought RCB, PBKS, and MI, the other teams in the playoffs, in contention for the top 2 spots this season.

England tour beckons, but Sai Sudharsan's focus is on IPL 2025 playoffsGujarat Titans opener Sai Sudharsan said he was happy about his India A call-up for the second match of the England tour but remains firmly focused on helping GT navigate the high-stakes IPL 2025 playoffs.

RCB captain Rajat Patidar fit for SRH game: Andy FlowerRajat Patidar has recovered from his finger injury and is ready to play against SunRisers Hyderabad, confirmed head coach Andy Flower. The team remains confident despite a long break and a change of venue for the match.

Rishabh Pant wants LSG to learn and move forward from disappointing IPL 2025Lucknow Super Giants captain Rishabh Pant has called on his side to reflect on the lessons from a disappointing IPL campaign, after a consolation victory over Gujarat Titans in Ahmedabad brought their season to a close.

Only Test: Top 3 script world record as England post 498 on Day 1 vs ZimbabweEngland vs Zimbabwe, Only Test: Zak Crawley, Ben Duckett and Ollie Pope hit a hundred each as England posted 498 runs for 3 on Day 1 in Nottingham. Joe Root, meanwhile, completed 13,000 runs in Test cricket, achieving the major landmark on Thursday.

IPL playoffs race: RCB's top 2 hopes brighten after GT lose to LSGGujarat Titans' slip-up against LSG has blown the IPL top 2 race wide open. This has brought RCB, PBKS, and MI, the other teams in the playoffs, in contention for the top 2 spots this season.

England tour beckons, but Sai Sudharsan's focus is on IPL 2025 playoffsGujarat Titans opener Sai Sudharsan said he was happy about his India A call-up for the second match of the England tour but remains firmly focused on helping GT navigate the high-stakes IPL 2025 playoffs.

RCB captain Rajat Patidar fit for SRH game: Andy FlowerRajat Patidar has recovered from his finger injury and is ready to play against SunRisers Hyderabad, confirmed head coach Andy Flower. The team remains confident despite a long break and a change of venue for the match.

Rishabh Pant wants LSG to learn and move forward from disappointing IPL 2025Lucknow Super Giants captain Rishabh Pant has called on his side to reflect on the lessons from a disappointing IPL campaign, after a consolation victory over Gujarat Titans in Ahmedabad brought their season to a close.

Only Test: Top 3 script world record as England post 498 on Day 1 vs ZimbabweEngland vs Zimbabwe, Only Test: Zak Crawley, Ben Duckett and Ollie Pope hit a hundred each as England posted 498 runs for 3 on Day 1 in Nottingham. Joe Root, meanwhile, completed 13,000 runs in Test cricket, achieving the major landmark on Thursday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
